summary: Ancient Greece was a civilization around the northeastern Mediterranean Sea. It lasted from the 12th century BC to about 600 AD. This period is known for its city-states, like Athens and Sparta. After a dark age, cities started to grow again in the 8th century BC. Classical Greece, famous for its philosophy, art, and democracy, began with the Greco-Persian Wars. Alexander the Great later united Greece and conquered much of Asia. Greek culture had a big impact on ancient Rome and is seen as the start of Western civilization. The Parthenon in Athens is a famous symbol of this era.
title: Ancient Greece
